name: Blastar
description: Viewed from above and set in space, Blastar is a multi-directionally scrolling shoot 'em up. Each of the 12 levels have aliens coming at you in all directions, and you must use the scanner to see where they are, and fly around taking them out. The ship has heavy inertia, so you can't brake and steer instantly. Contact with aliens weakens your ship, and eventually costs you one of your 3 lives. The game features a full techno soundtrack, with 1 Megabyte of sound and 3 Megabytes of graphics - both high figures for an OCS game. The playing area totals 400 screens, with animated backgrounds

shot.caption: Each level has a different mission objective.
The first level. Enemies can be seen as yellow dots on the scanner in the right corner.
Firing at one of the targets I'm supposed to destroy.
Using a smart-bomb to kill all enemies on the screen at once.
The first boss. It's almost impossible to see it, because it looks just like the background...
The boss flashes when fired at. Now you can see how it looks like a bit better...
In the shops, you can buy better weapons, increase your speed, or get other improvements for your ship.
Killing an insect with my new rocket-weapon.
Surrounded by hostile spheres, in some kind of volcanic environment.
Firing at some kind of hatch, to reveal the secret tunnel underneath.
When you enter a tunnel, the game suddenly changes into a side-scroller.
When fighting this boss, the game changes perspective again. Now you look at your ship from behind (ship is seen to the left).
Now a whole level is played side-scrolling.
Fire-fight with a huge boss at the end of the level.
